SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.persistit
Class Task

java.lang.Object
  com.persistit.Task
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BackupTask, IntegrityCheck, StatisticsTask, StreamLoader, StreamSaver, TaskCheck
public abstract class Task
extends Object
implements Runnable

Abstract superclass of classes that perform long-running utility operations, such as export, import and integrity check. Concrete classes should frequently call the poll() method to allow users to stop, suspend or view progress and should post all progress messages to the message log by calling postMessage(String, int).

Version:
1.0
Author:
peter

setPersistit

public void setPersistit(Persistit persistit)
Set the Persistit instance to be accessed by this Task.

Parameters:

runTask

protected abstract void runTask()
                         throws Exception
Called by a newly created Thread to perform the task.

Throws:
Exception

poll

protected void poll()
Tests whether this Task should stop or suspend. The concrete task implementation should call poll frequently. The default mechanism for stopping a task does not use the deprecated Thread.stop() method because it is unsafe. Instead, the task should call poll().

parseTreeList

protected Tree[] parseTreeList(String specification)
                        throws PersistitException
Parses a String that represents a list of Volume/Tree pairs. Format: volumeName1,treeName1,treeName2;volumeName2,treeName1,treeName2,..

Parameters:
specification - The list of Volume/Tree pairs, specified as a String
Returns:
Array of Trees specified by the list.
Throws:
PersistitException

setup

public void setup(long taskId,
                  String description,
                  String owner,
                  long maxTime,
                  int verbosity)
           throws Exception
Sets up a Task.

Parameters:
taskId - unique identifier for this task invocation
description - Description of this task
owner - Hostname and/or username
maxTime - Maximum wall-clock duration, in milliseconds, that Task will be allowed to run
verbosity - Level at which messages posted by the running task will be retained in the message log.
Throws:
Exception

start

public void start()
Start this Task

Throws:
IllegalStateException - If this task has already been started

stop

public void stop()
Request this task to stop. Note: a subclass could reimplement this using _thread.stop() if necessary.

suspend

public void suspend()
Request this task to suspend. Note: a subclass could reimplement this using _thread.suspend() if necessary.

resume

public void resume()
Request this task to resume. Note: a subclass could reimplement this using _thread.resume() if necessary.

setMaximumTime

public void setMaximumTime(long maxTime)
Set the maximum amount of wall-clock time this Task will be permitted to run. If the Task is suspended, the amount of time spend in the suspended state is not counted toward this maximum.

Parameters:
maxTime - The time, in milliseconds

setMessageLogVerbosity

public void setMessageLogVerbosity(int verbosity)
Set verbosity level for selecting posted messages. Current available values are LOG_NORMAL and LOG_VERBOSE.

Parameters:
verbosity - Verbosity

public PrintWriter getMessageWriter()
Returns the current PrintWriter, or null if there is none.

Returns:
Current PrintWriter

getStatus

public abstract String getStatus()
Returns a short String message describing the current state of this Task. It should convey a measurement of progress to the end-user.

Returns:
A description of this Task's current state

getStatusDetail

public String getStatusDetail()
Returns a String message describing the current state of this Task, possibly in greater detail than getStatus(). The default implementation returns the same description as getStatus .

Returns:
A detailed description of this Task's current state.

getRemainingTime

public long getRemainingTime()
Indicates how much time remains (in milliseconds) until this Task's maximum time has expired.

postMessage

protected void postMessage(String message,
                           int level)
Posts a message (typically to denote progress, error or other interim information) to the message log.

Parameters:
message - The message
level - Indicates the verbosity level. The message is posted only if the level of the message is below the current verbosity threshhold set through setMessageLogVerbosity(int).

endMessage

protected void endMessage(int level)

appendMessage

protected void appendMessage(String fragment,
                             int level)
Appends a String to the final message of the log.

Parameters:
fragment - The message fragment to append
level - Indicates the verbosity level. The message is posted only if the level of the message is below the current verbosity threshold set through setMessageLogVerbosity(int).

                               boolean details,
